question: Which of the following is correct for relay cropping?
option1: Second crop grown after harvesting  of first crop
option2: Second crop grown after flowering of first crop
option4: Second crop grown along with first crop
answer: Second crop grown after flowering of first crop
explanation: Relay intercropping or relay cropping is a system in which a second crop is planted when an existing crop has just flowered but before harvesting. Thus relay cropping has a minimal temporal overlap of two or more crops. In India, Rice-Cauliflower-Onion-summer gourds is one example of relay cropping
